alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Bryan; Carter; Coal; Johnston; Love; Marshall; Murray (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 10:20PM CDT until June 17 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT FOR JOHNSTON...WESTERN BRYAN...LOVE...SOUTHERN COAL...CARTER... MARSHALL...SOUTHWESTERN ATOKA AND MURRAY COUNTIES... At 1018 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles south of Scullin to 4 miles northeast of Lake Murray to near Burneyville, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...The Ardmore Mesonet measured a 69 mph wind gust. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Ardmore, Durant, Sulphur, Madill, Atoka, Tishomingo, Davis, Marietta, Lone Grove, Wilson, Kingston, Dickson, Colbert, Caddo, Mannsville, Springer, Ravia, Achille, Thackerville, and Wapanucka. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage in and around Ardmore. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.

area.areaDesc: Atoka; Bryan; Carter; Coal; Johnston; Love; Marshall; Murray
